text: welcome everyone we are delighted to
have you all here for this informative
session on integrating Amazon RDS Oracle
with Amazon elastic file system EFS
in this session we aim to share with you
how to integrate EFS with RDS Oracle and
what are its benefits we will also
provide you with a quick demo on how to
do it my name is Javed Muhammad and I am
a database Solutions architect at Amazon
I'm joined by my colleagues Vishal and
sharath who will be co-presenting
various segments of this session
alongside me
without further delay let us dive into
the world of RDS CFS integration and
explore how this integration works and
the benefits that it has got to offer
the agenda for today's session is as
follows
introduction to Amazon RDS for Oracle
and Amazon EFS overview of various data
moment options available when migrating
databases to Amazon RDS for Oracle
understanding of how the integration of
Amazon EFS with Amazon RDS for Oracle
can simplify the database migration
process
a step-by-step guide on integrating
Amazon EFS with Amazon RDS for Oracle
along with the demo
let's begin by exploring what is Amazon
RDS for Oracle
to begin with a brief introduction of
RDS
Amazon relational database service RDS
was built by AWS as a way to help
customers reduce the complexity in
supporting critical transactional
applications by making it easy to set up
operate and scale a relational database
in the cloud
RDS automates time consuming
Administration tasks such as Hardware
provisioning database setup patching and
backups while providing cost efficient
and resizable capacity
RDS makes your databases available and
durable by supporting options such as
multi-az data replication automated
backups and snapshots
RDS makes your databases more performant
and scalable by supporting scale compute
and storage within just a few clicks
with minimal downtime for your
application
furthermore RDS makes your databases
more secure and compliant by supporting
data encryption at rest and in transit
RDS is currently offered for six
familiar database engines that is MySQL
postgres SQL mariadb SQL Server Oracle
and Amazon Aurora which is compatible
with mySQL and postgresql
in a nutshell RDS provides customers
with lower total cost of ownership
easier management
so that they can focus on the things
that matter for their business and
applications
now let's talk about what is Amazon
elastic file system
Amazon elastic file system EFS provides
serverless fully elastic file storage so
that you can share file data without
provisioning or managing storage
capacity and performance
Amazon EFS is designed to provide secure
access for thousands of connections for
Amazon elastic compute Cloud ec2
instances as well as AWS container and
serverless compute services
Amazon EFS also simultaneously supports
on-premises servers using a traditional
file permissions model file locking and
hierarchical directory structure through
the NFS V4 protocol
Amazon EFS is built to scale on demand
to petabytes without disrupting
applications growing and shrinking
automatically as you add and remove
files
with Amazon EFS you pay only for the
storage used by your file system and
there is no minimum fee or setup cost
because Amazon EFS has a simple web
services interface you can create and
configure file systems quickly and
easily
the service manages all the file storage
infrastructure for you meaning
that you can avoid the complexity of
deploying patching and maintaining
complex file system configurations
Amazon EFS is designed for 11 lines of
durability and up to four lines of
availability
EFS is also performant and designed to
provide the throughput iops and low
latency necessary for a broad range of
workloads
EFS is cost optimized EFS provides four
storage classes with different price and
performance characteristics it comes
with automatic life cycle management to
transition infrequently accessed files
to lower cost infrequent access storage
classes and it offers intelligent
tiering to optimize cost for use cases
with variable access patterns
now let's talk about the use cases of
Amazon EFS
EFS is designed to serve the vast
majority of file based workloads
covering a wide spectrum of performance
needs these range from single threaded
latency sensitive workloads such as
developer productivity tools to highly
parallelized scale out jobs requiring
high throughput like big data and
machine learning applications and
everything in between
some of the most common use cases of
Amazon EFS include
simplification and centralization of
devops which includes CI CD pipelines
code repositories and issue tracking
common applications in this category
includes Jenkins Confluence and git
next we have web serving and content
management which involves creation and
modification of digital web content
then we have data science and analytics
EFS enables customers to accelerate Data
Insights machine learning training
inference and Analysis
next we have media processing which
includes image processing and video
hosting
EFS is also used as secondary storage to
store backups for databases like Oracle
Cassandra and mongodb
last and certainly not the least EFS is
used in modern application development
it allows customers to build new Cloud
native applications and migrate custom
Enterprise applications without any
re-architecture and modernize at your
own pace
now let's talk about data moment options
with RDS Oracle
here we will talk about new Option of
EFS integration with Amazon RDS for
Oracle there are several options for
data moment into RDS for Oracle instance
we can move the data from Source
database which could be on-prem Oracle
database or RDS Oracle database or
Oracle database on ec2 to Target
database that is RDS Oracle using
different ways like TB links over the
network logical replication using tools
like DMS or Golden Gate bulk load using
data pump Etc
we typically use data pump with S3
integration option and the steps
involved with this approach are
initially we take an export backup of
source database using data pump the
backup pump file is then copied to S3
bucket
The Next Step involves downloading the
backup dump file from S3 bucket to RDS
Oracle instance where we intend to
import the data
and then we finally perform an import
these dump files occupy storage space on
the RDS Oracle instance itself
for example if you have a one terabyte
dump file that needs to be loaded into
your instance you need to create a two
terabyte RDS Oracle instance
this allows you to Stage that one
terabyte dump file load it into a
terabyte of table spaces and then
subsequently drop that one terabyte dump
file
as a result you will have a terabyte of
space that may not be immediately
reusable as we may not have a need for
it and also we cannot shrink the
allocated storage in RDS Oracle
when you get to larger sizes especially
with large database migrations it can
really add up and customers end up
paying for the extra unused storage from
the moment it is allocated
with EFS integration option you can
stage transitory files like Oracle data
pump export files on EFS file system and
directly import from it
it offers faster migration of data as
compared to migration or database link
you can use Amazon EFS file system
mounted on Amazon RDS for Oracle
database instances as a landing zone for
various Oracle files required for
migration or data transfer using it as a
landing Zone helps to save the
allocation of extra storage space on the
Amazon RDS instance to hold the files
you can also mount an EFS file system
directly to an on-premise server as a
further means to simplify the migration
process
the Amazon EFS file system can
automatically scale from gigabytes to
petabytes of data without needing to
provision storage
there are no minimum fees or setup costs
and you pay only for what you use
Amazon RDS for Oracle with Amazon EFS is
well suited to support a broad spectrum
of use cases such as share a file system
between applications and multiple
database servers use it as an upload
location for the native dumps and
backups required for migration store and
share arm and backup and Recovery logs
without allocation of additional storage
space on the server
use Oracle utilities such as util
underscore file to read and write files
now I will hand over to Vishal to walk
us through the steps to integrate EFS
with Amazon RDS for Oracle

let's get started
first step is making sure that your RDS
for Oracle instance has an IAM role

system later on
in this
we will create an IAM role and

your RDS for Oracle instance
next step is to create EFS file system
if it is not already created and update

this is to make sure RDS Oracle instance

we use standard or standard IA storage

we would create the mount Targets in

we also update the policy to allow

in this step we will Mount the EFS file

only root user has privileges on the
file system
before we can mount the file system in
an ec2 instance we have to update the
mount Target Security Group to add an
inbound rule to allow access on Port
The Source will be ec2 Security Group
after mounting the EFS file system on an
ec2 instance change permissions for the
file system to 777 so that other users
like Oracle installation user on RDS
Oracle will be able to read write files
from this EFS file system
next step is to enable EFS integration
option in an option group of RDS Oracle

first we need to create an option group

integration while while adding the

system ID
second
we will need to modify RDS Oracle
instance to use new Option Group which
has EFS underscore underscore
integration included
third we will want to make sure the
security group of Mount Target is
updated to allow inbound access on Port
2049 from RDS Oracle instance using RDS
Oracle Security Group as source
lastly to access EFS file system from
RDS Oracle instance we will create a
directory object using
RDS admin util package under RDS admin
schema and the procedure is create
directory EFS with EFS ID in the path
for EFS attribute
this concludes all the steps required to

Oracle instance
